abstract: He isn’t a Citigroup executive or director. But for more than a decade, Prince Walid bin Talal has been an unofficial godfather at the firm by dint of his stake in the financial giant. Securing his blessing was often necessary to introduce new initiatives at the bank. Conversely, the withholding of his backing was a damaging, if not fatal, blow. Just ask Charles O. Prince III.
lead_paragraph: He isn’t a Citigroup executive or director. But for more than a decade, Prince Walid bin Talal has been an unofficial godfather at the firm by dint of his stake in the financial giant. Securing his blessing was often necessary to introduce new initiatives at the bank. Conversely, the withholding of his backing was a damaging, if not fatal, blow. Just ask Charles O. Prince III.

headline.main: Walid’s New Rival for Citi’s Deference
